chapters.title: Robot Types & Subsystems
chapters.summary: Robotics spans mobile platforms, manipulators, and specialized systems. Each robot integrates mechanical structure (chassis, joints), actuators that produce motion, sensors that measure state, and controllers that decide actions. Coordinate frames define how we describe positions and orientations, enabling consistent reasoning about motion. This chapter introduces the vocabulary and mental models to analyze any robot you encounter.

chapters.title: Torque, Speed, and Gear Ratios
chapters.summary: Mechanical power is the product of torque and rotational speed. Gear trains trade torque for speed according to ratio, impacting acceleration and hill-climbing capability. Backlash, efficiency, and traction influence real-world performance. This chapter builds intuition and gives simple calculations for selecting gear ratios and chassis layouts.
